name: BEST WESTERN Braid Hills Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel on Saturday night totally exhausted after a stressful day. The receptionist (female, Irish accent) was so friendly and helpful and assured us that we would have a quiet room as requested. Our room was very clean and comfortable and we could have heard a pin drop all night!! Breakfast was excellent and even more so as the dining room had a lovely view. All in all a wonderful experience!!
reviews.title: Wonderful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over a Friday and Saturday night with my wife. Booked on line and thought the rate very reasonable. Upon check in were shown to a rather small room but when we queried this the duty manager upgraded us to a spacious family room for no extra charge. As others have noted the style of the decor is a little dated, but our room and all the communal areas were spotlessly clean. In our room the shower was fine, though it was sited over the bath. They include a couple of complimentary bottles of water along with the usual tea and coffee which was a nice touch. Parking on site is free and the staff throughout were really friendly. Buffet breakfast was lovely, too. We used the bus (£1.40) to get into town, though the hotel is situated maybe 10 mins wak from bars and shops at Morningside. We dined at the next door pub/bistro one evening which was very reasonably priced. We will definitely stay again when we are in Edinburgh.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked 6 nights B&B in April here as we wanted to go to the Fringe(first time) .The receptionist was great and we we were given a family room (asked for a double) that had plenty of room, nice bathroom and great view. The car parking was free -(some of the hotels in the city were charging.) and the bus stop was just in front of the Hotel to take us into the City Centre, so didn't need to drive in. Breakfasts were good with plenty of choice. We found the staff friendly and helpful. Agree with other reviewers that it did look a bit tired ( does that add something to a lovely old building? ) and we didn't have a fantastic shower either. But overall we were very pleased with our stay. We are thinking of going to the fringe next year and if we do we will stay here , and will book early to get a good price again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in brill location !

reviews.text: Just been to the fringe for 2 days and stayed for one night here.There not being much choice as we left it quite late to book. Arrived early but after a short wait checked into a 3rd floor spacious room with a magnificent view over all Edinburgh. The room was clean, probably because of the traditional style looked dated but was acceptable for the price we paid. The shower was the weediest affair i've experienced. I think nowadays we expect power showers but everything else was acceptable, free bottled water tea and coffee chocolate and shortbreads..Yum.
reviews.title: A glorious building and a good stay

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good with plenty of selection.
reviews.title: Visit to Braids Hill hotel Edinburgh

reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights in this hotel recently, with the festival on I went ahead with the booking even though it was way out from the centre of the city and quite expensive at £120 per night ex breakfast.
reviews.title: Worst Shower in Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel looks quite tired and the rooms have been adapted many times over the years and are quite small .....could not believe the small bathroom and the shower only managed a trickle of water so it was a matter of dancing around to get wet.
reviews.title: Average hotel, rude receptionist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and everything was clean but it just needs a bit of an injection of money to bring it up to standard.
reviews.title: Our two night stay was excllent

reviews.text: Nice hotel with pleasant views; especially from dining room. Our room was small, rather cramped and at the back of the hotel. The breakfast was good and the service in the dining room also helpful and polite. Unfortunately one of the reception staff (female, Irish accent) was rude on 2 separate occasions which spoilt the stay.
reviews.title: Unpleasant experience

reviews.text: Our two night stay was excellent. The room was of a good size OK the view wasnt great but we didnt intend to stay in there all day. If you want a super view try the restaraunt. The main reason for our stay was to go to the Royal Military Tattoo at the Castle. The bus stops are just down some steps from the car park but be aware the buses dont give any change but the reception will change your money for you.Talking of reception this one was the most cheerfull and friendly we have met. All we can say is try it for your self
reviews.title: Overpriced like much of Edinburgh but good location and friendly staff

reviews.text: We stayed here recently, three nights over two weeks. My sister's home is five minutes drive away and as she is now in a Care Home we are in the process of clearing her home for sale.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for our Needs

reviews.text: First night we stayed was last Tuesday in June and I booked by phoning hotel to book a double or twin room. Our room was on ground floor and was a lovely big family room with large bay window, two large comfortable chairs facing large wall TV and coffee table with tea making facilities. We were happy with this room which cost £100 for the night.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel, Nicely Located, Excellent Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next time we stayed was Friday 6 July and I booked via the Best Western Hotels 08 phone line and room cost £94.50 per night. I also booked another two nights, 17th and 18th July at same cost. The room we got this time was on the top floor overlooking the main road and was tiny in comparison. One comfortable chair and one other which we had to move about to watch TV before going to the Bucksone Bistro, which was very good and reasonable priced including a bottle of nice wine.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Due to adverse weather conditions on the Sat (motorway and roads blocked with water) we decided not to drive back home and I phoned the hotel to see if they had a vacant room. We were lucky I was told they had two available. When we checked in at 5.00pm we were told the room allocated to us had developed a water leak so we had been given the large room with canopied bed etc. This was lovely and cost £120 as against £145 if we had requested this.
reviews.title: Good wedding package

reviews.text: Very comfortable bed and small sofa and comfortable chairs.
reviews.title: Traditional and comfortable!

reviews.text: Our room was SOOOO small. Picture the end of the bed...now picture the wall at the end of the bed being only approx.15 inches away.(I am not exaggerating) No counters in the bathroom. Fortunately, I used my Best Western Points for my stay but seriously... they need to knock out a wall because for the price they DO charge, it is just not right. There was so little room that we used the bar and sitting room to use our computers.
reviews.title: My rating is for the employees:)

reviews.text: Now as for the employees, they were all great! Especially the gal at the front desk. I don't know how to spell her name however she said the spelling was like ":granny". Very helpful and cheerful everyday:) (We stayed 3 nights). Then there was Alan. He was also very accommodating.
reviews.title: Damp, dingy and overpriced, but excellent staff.

reviews.text: In summary, we would stay there again, however would ensure our room was larger.
reviews.title: homey and friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Patty/ Washington State/USA
reviews.title: Braid hills, nice job

reviews.text: As above. Everything felt damp and the room smelt musty. Badly needs updated. Room that we were allocated was very small. Definitely inferior to other Best Westerns. The only upside is the wonderful staff and also the free parking. Perfectly satisfactory hotel, but only for around half the price.
reviews.title: nostalgia

description: The Best Western Edinburgh Braid Hills Hotel is magnificently situated in its own grounds, with panoramic views right across the City of Edinburgh, to the Pentlands, the Firth of Forth and the Fife hills beyond. Great contemporary Scottish cuisine served in either of the hotel’s two restaurants and genuine, friendly service from the all staff is complemented by ample free parking, free wifi and convenient access to a frequent bus service into the city centre. Come and experience a hotel stay with a real Scottish feel!
